ClimDatDownloadR 0.1.7
  • Get started
  • Reference

    Converting .tif-raster files in one specified directory into ASCII-Grids

    convert.to.asc.Rd

    This function converts and saves all .tif-raster files to ASCII-file format to a specified location and creates a new folder named "ASCII_files" with a unique timestamp of the current system time.

    convert.to.asc(
  save.location = "./",
  time.stamp.var = str_replace_all(str_replace_all(paste0(Sys.time()), pattern = ":",
    replacement = "-"), pattern = " ", replacement = "_")
)

    Arguments

    save.location

    string (directory path). The directory where .tif-raster files are saved.
    Default: "./" (Working directory)

    time.stamp.var

    string. Timestamp to create unique directories for multiple run outputs.
    Default: stringr::str_replace_all(stringr::str_replace_all(paste0(
    Sys.time()),pattern = ":",replacement = "-"))

    Value

    This function returns ASCII-format raster files to a new directory. This directory is dynamically created.

    Author

    Helge Jentsch

    Examples

    convert.to.asc(save.location = system.file("pictures/", package = "rgdal"))

    Contents

    Developed by Helge Jentsch, Maria Bobrowski, Johannes Weidinger.
